snippet: At their town-hall-style debate, President Obama and Mitt Romney circled around each other like tomcats in an alley as they vied for dominance in an effort to reach voters.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column observes that the second presidential debate was marked by a series of tense exchanges in which Pres Obama and Mitt Romney circled each other, vying for dominance; contends that Obama came out ahead of Romney in a number of instances.
lead_paragraph: At their town-hall-style debate, President Obama and Mitt Romney circled around each other like tomcats in an alley as they vied for dominance in an effort to reach voters.

headline.main: In Debate’s Dance, Romney Has More Missteps
headline.print_headline: In Debate’s Dance, Romney Has More Missteps
